channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @jeffjarvis @hblodget It's not only of interest to journalists.
@HC_Richardson @JoeTrippi So why aren't the Dems at least as bold with the truth? It's like they're afraid of offending someone.
The first three quarters of last night's Knicks game were sublime. Alas, they had to play one more quarter. Oy. https://t.co/o3NS9IQ8da
Boca or Bucha was one of our many slogans at Living Videotext. https://t.co/568ctsDBRo
Introducing Amazon Astro, Household Robot for Home Monitoring, with Alexa. https://t.co/VdDUaljKoL
Wordle 292 4/6 ‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú üü®üü©‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú ‚¨úüü©üü©üü©‚¨ú üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©

I think maybe we should show the Bluesky folk how to make a distributed Twitter without reinventing everything.
To start, why not use an existing identity system that scales, like the one they use in Twitter. It really works.
And websockets seems to work, and a lot of effort has gone into scaling it, presumably, so why not use it‚Ä¶ ?
Here‚Äôs a controversial idea, RSS has been reinvented so many times, why not accept all of them, from 0.90 to 2.0 and RDF and Atom and ActivityPub, with a perfectly simple API to hide all the history? Everyone can be happy. ü§†
BTW, this one I already have in the form of a Node.js package. Haven't released it yet, but now I have a good reason to top it off to get it out at least in beta form.
Weekend Update Jokes That Are too Hot to Air. https://t.co/IqY0lkz48j
Trump deflects blame for silence on Jan. 6 and says he would have gone to the Capitol 'in a minute' that day. https://t.co/mPBkd034RE
Digitizing audio that's been unheard for about 100 years. https://t.co/jjmtpG8C0e
Ken Smith: Outlining, a third try. https://t.co/oaLsy2d2la
To the bluesky team ‚Äî RSS is used for news, not just blogging. https://t.co/qOe3f2TaAF

A UI puzzle‚Ä¶ Here are all the font-awesome icons. https://t.co/klaV90fmOg Imagine a long paragraph, too long to fit, the extra text is hidden. There‚Äôs an icon that means ‚Äúshow the rest of the paragraph,‚Äù another means ‚Äúmake it small again.‚Äù Which two icons to use?
Meta is reportedly making ‚ÄòZuck Bucks‚Äô. https://t.co/EjDbL7XBFc
Elite D.C. appears to be getting pummeled with Covid. https://t.co/166He7Dlwy

@b0rk https://t.co/DQBgJU09hv was allowing this for a long time but then stopped. It's a very rational thing and I didn't understand their reason for stopping. My friend @rswilbourn is a DNS expert, I wonder if he knows why roots of domains can't be cnames, or can they?

@tanyaweiman But seriously, basketball isn't for me about winning or losing. it's what Tracy said, it's the character of the players and how they make a team. I wouldn't want Lebron because he has nothing left to achieve, but the knicks are full of players who have love and are hungry.
@tanyaweiman the nets are for ny basketball fans who are all about winning. they're the yankees fans who rooted for the mets when the mets were winning. they are not ny sports fans as far as i'm concerned.
@tanyaweiman i was "in character."

@jayrosen_nyu Yes, I've got the popcorn out. Expecting to enjoy the show. You know Twitter already has a really good API, so there's some cause for hope they will come up with something good. And if they deliver, I've got some juicy bits to hook up with what they build. ;-)

The thing that's so scary about what's happening in Ukraine, is the kind of killing and destroying they're doing is getting close to the kind of destruction a nuclear weapon does.
People who could do what the Russians do are the kind of people who could fire off the nukes.
Perhaps we have to stop thinking about provoking them and start imagining how provoked we will let ourselves be without doing something to stop it.
At some point we will have to call their bluff, right?
And in the meantime, the Repubs in Congress are daring us to see them for exactly what they are, the enemy within. They are on the same team as the Russians.
We have to assume their hearts are as cold as Putin's.
@rtanglao Radio UserLand was not a link blogging tool. You're thinking of Radio3.

I needed a podcast feed to test with so I used the NYT Daily podcast. My god they have shows going back to 2017. I think that's when the podcast actually started. That's a lot of podcasts. Remarkable. https://t.co/8eZeHqIq1w

@tanyaweiman Okay I just watched it on my phone. Best line. Interviewer: What you think about the Nets? Morgan: Who? Exactly. I would've explained to the asshole interviewer that we love the Knicks simply because we love them and that's it. Nothing more to say.
@tanyaweiman I have HBO. ;-)
